H0.text: Feldspar and quartz are the two most common silicates.

H1.text: Olivine and quartz are the two most common silicates.

H2.text: Micas and feldspar are the two most common silicates.

H3.text: Micas and quartz are the two most common silicates.

A4.text: Feldspars make up about 60% of the Earth's crust and 41% of the Earth's continental crust by weight.

A5.text: Feldspars crystallize from magma as both intrusive and extrusive igneous rocks and are also present in many types of metamorphic rock.
